paper_abstract: In this paper, Yager's g-implications are generalized, and a new class of implications, called (g, u)-implications, is introduced. It is shown that (g, u)-implications are not only the generalization of Yager'sg-implications, but also the generalization of (S, N)-, R-, QL-implications. Basic properties and characterization of these implications are discussed. Furthermore, the distributive equations of these implications are investigated. (C) 2013 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On a new class of implications: (g, u)-implications and the distributive equations
